intro: Rhaphiostylis beninensis, commonly known as the Benin starfruit, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes species known for their medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit, which resembles a starfruit, is edible and has a mild, sweet flavor. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
